alert.note: Alert for Johnston (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 01 at 9:35AM EDT until May 02 at 9:12AM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Raleigh NC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Neuse River At Smithfield. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding begins along the Neuse Riverwalk. Water nears the base of the holding tank at the water treatment plant. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:15 AM EDT Monday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 15.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - Flood History...No available flood history. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (8 am EDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Thu Fri Neuse River Smithfield 15.0 14.6 Mon 9 am EDT 13.9 9.8 8.6 8.2 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this evening by 945 PM EDT.
